elements.text: mouse() returns all the atributes of the mouse.

mx, my, mb, mhs, mvs = mouse()
-- mx: x position
-- my: y position
-- mb: the state of the mouse's buttons
-- mhs: horizontal scrolling (-1, 0, or 1)
-- mvs: vertical scrolling (-1, 0, or 1)

Position is calculated relative to the
upper left corrner of the project, windowed
or un-windowed.

function _draw()
	cls()
	mx, my = mouse()
	print(mx.." : "..my,7)
end

The state of the mouse's button is 
read as a number.
1 or 0b001 -> left click
2 or 0b010 -> right click
4 or 0b100 -> middle click

This means that if we press the left
and right mouse button at the same time,
mb will read as 3.

We can use some binary opporations to
selectively listen to a certain button.
